alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 30 at 4:54PM PDT until May 30 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Ventura County in southwestern California... * Until 900 PM PDT. * At 454 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated a nearly stationary thunderstorm producing heavy rain over the Lockwood Valley and vicinity. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, highways, streets, and low water crossings. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lockwood Valley and surrounding areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are many low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
